articles.title: The most powerful woman in football - meet game's first female super agent
articles.summary: Super agent Rafaela Pimenta looks after some of the biggest names in the game. She has been speaking exclusively to the BBC

articles.title: How West Ham collapse at Chelsea led to mass brawl
articles.summary: Match of the Day pundit Shay Given breaks down how West Ham's frustration in their loss against Chelsea, after being two goals ahead, led to an on the pitch scuffle and Jean-Clair Todibo seeing red.

articles.title: How Ekitike is becoming Liverpool's star man
articles.summary: Match of the Day pundits Steph Houghton and Shay Given discuss how Hugo Ekitike has become Liverpool's star striker, as his chemistry with summer signing Florian Wirtz has emerged.

articles.title: 'Spurs want to stick with Frank but may have no choice'
articles.summary: The Football Focus team preview the game between Spurs and Man City, debating whether Spurs boss Thomas Frank will be able to navigate this challenging period.

articles.title: What can be done to disrupt Arsenal's identical set-pieces?
articles.summary: Match of the Day pundit Shay Given analyses how Arsenal take their set-pieces each week and what other teams need to do to disrupt their consistency.

articles.title: 'Someone will cry' - do clubs hold the power in the transfer market?
articles.summary: Football agent Rafaela Pimenta says the transfer system needs to change as clubs have too much power and are treating their players as "assets in a business", not as "humans".

articles.title: Pick your combined Man City-Chelsea XI
articles.summary: Women's Super League top Manchester City and Chelsea face each other on Sunday. Who makes your best XI from the two teams?

articles.title: Genius or obvious? Rosenior's subs inspire Chelsea comeback win
articles.summary: After Chelsea's first comeback win from two goals down in a Premier League match, were Liam Rosenior's substitutions against West Ham genius or obvious?

articles.title: Likened to Mbappe - teenager Kroupi flourishing at Bournemouth
articles.summary: Eli Junior Kroupi's stunning goal for Bournemouth against Wolves will help soften the blow of losing Antoine Semenyo to Manchester City.

articles.title: Moyes defiant after being booked for celebration
articles.summary: Everton manager David Moyes criticises the laws of the game after being booked for sprinting onto the pitch to celebrate Beto's last-gasp equaliser at Brighton.

articles.title: Ekitike double helps Liverpool cruise past Newcastle
articles.summary: Summer signing Huge Ekitike scores twice as Liverpool record their first league win of 2026, putting four goals past Newcastle United.

articles.title: Chelsea fight back to beat West Ham in dramatic derby
articles.summary: Chelsea come back from being two goals down at half-time to beat West Ham in stoppage time.

articles.title: Arsenal score four in superb win against Leeds
articles.summary: Arsenal get their title charge back on track with a dominant display against Leeds, their first win in four Premier League games.

articles.title: Kroupi scores stunner as Bournemouth beat Wolves
articles.summary: 19-year-old Eli Juniour Kroupi scores his eight Premier League goal of the season to help Bournemouth beat Wolves 2-0.

articles.title: Klopp urged me to take Man City assistant job - Lijnders
articles.summary: Pep Lijnders says former Liverpool manager Jurgen Klopp urged him to take the job as Pep Guardiola's assistant coach at Manchester City.

articles.title: What's meant for you won't pass you by - Calvert-Lewin
articles.summary: Dominic Calvert-Lewin discusses the loneliness he experienced while waiting for a transfer this summer and how his form since joining Leeds has re-ignited his England hopes.

articles.title: A 10-point lead cut to three - is it just a blip for Coventry?
articles.summary: With their Championship lead down to three points how worried should Coventry City fans be about a potential promotion meltdown?

articles.title: The Basque derby - the friendliest rivalry in world football?
articles.summary: With a sense of shared identity and fans mixing in the stands, is the Basque derby between Athletic Club and Real Sociedad the friendliest in the world?

articles.title: 'Hollywood welcome' - inside a Wrexham transfer window
articles.summary: With the potential for deadline day deals, BBC Sport looks at how Wrexham's recruitment works under the ownership of Ryan Reynolds and Rob Mac

articles.title: Holloway slams 'unprofessional' Clarke ban
articles.summary: Swindon Town boss Ian Holloway criticises FA officials as captain Ollie Clarke is banned 24 hours before Saturday's League Two meeting with Barrow.
